meanings.definition: A person who is eccentric or foolish
meanings.sent1: The old man who claimed aliens were living in his garden was considered a crackpot by the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to that crackpot; he thinks he can talk to animals.
meanings.sent3: The crackpot at the park was convinced that squirrels were plotting against him.
meanings.sent4: She dismissed him as a crackpot, believing his wild theories about time travel.
meanings.sent5: The town had its fair share of crackpots who believed in outlandish conspiracy theories.

meanings.definition: A crack or flaw in something, especially pottery or glass
meanings.sent1: The delicate vase had a tiny crackpot near the base, making it unsuitable for holding water.
meanings.sent2: The antique mirror had a noticeable crackpot running along the edge.
meanings.sent3: The crackpot in the window pane distorted the view of the garden outside.
meanings.sent4: The crackpot in the windshield grew longer with each passing mile.
meanings.sent5: The potter carefully inspected each piece for any crackpot before firing them in the kiln.
